alert.note: Alert for Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:06PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN HOCKING COUNTY THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 205 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Hocking Hills State Park, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hocking Hills State Park, South Bloomingville, Gibisonville and Ilesboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
